column2: PhaseBio Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company, which engages in the development and commercialization of novel therapies for cardiopulmonary diseases. The company is headquartered in Malvern, Pennsylvania and currently employs 32 full-time employees. The firm is focused on the development and commercialization of therapies to treat orphan diseases, with an initial focus on cardiopulmonary indications. The Companyâ€™s lead product candidate, PB2452, is a novel reversal agent for the antiplatelet drug ticagrelor, which the Company is developing for the treatment of patients on ticagrelor who are experiencing a major bleeding event or those who require urgent surgery. Its product candidate, PB1046, is a once-weekly fusion protein for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension, or PAH. PB1046 utilizes its proprietary elastin-like polypeptide (ELP), technology, which also serves as the engine for its preclinical pipeline. Its ELP biopolymer technology utilizes a mechanism of slow absorption through a reversible phase transition and a prolonged circulatory half-life.
